item.title: Georgia's president vetoes the so-called 'Russian law' targeting the media that has sparked weeks of mass protests
item.description: Georgia's president vetoes the so-called 'Russian law' targeting the media that has sparked weeks of mass protests

item.title: Militia clashes rock western Libyan town. At least 1 civilian was killed, officials say
item.description: Libyan health authorities say clashes between government-allied militias rocked the western town of Zawiya, killing at least one civilian man and wounding 22 others

item.title: Tunisians stage anti-migrant protest as the number of stranded in transit to Europe grows
item.description: Hundreds of anti-migrant protestors have marched through the streets of a Tunisian town where many migrants are living while waiting to try and travel by boat to Europe

item.title: Chinese ambassador promises 'friendship' as 2 Chinese warships dock in Cambodia
item.description: Two Chinese warships have docked at a commercial port in Cambodia, in preparation for joint naval exercises between the two countries

item.title: An ultimatum raises pressure on Netanyahu to make postwar plans for Gaza
item.description: Pressure is coming from his own War Cabinet and his country’s closest ally.

item.title: It was once a center of Islamic learning. Now Mali's historic city of Djenné mourns lack of visitors
item.description: Mali’s historic city of Djenné was once a center of Islamic learning, known for its sprawling mud-brick mosque that has been on the UNESCO World Heritage in Danger list since 2016

item.title: Malaysia minister says terror suspect who killed 2 police officers acted on his own
item.description: Malaysia says the man who attacked a police station and killed two officers is believed to have acted on his own despite suspected links to the Jemaah Islamiyah extremist group

item.title: Parts of northern India scorched by extreme heat with New Delhi on high alert
item.description: On Friday, parts of New Delhi reported up to 116 degrees Fahrenheit.

item.title: US national security adviser, Saudi Arabia's crown prince meet to discuss 'semi-final' security deal
item.description: President Joe Biden’s national security adviser Jake Sullivan has met with Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to discuss what the kingdom described as the “semi-final” version of a wide-ranging security agreement between the countries

item.title: Ukraine and Russia exchange drone attacks while Russia continues its push in the east
item.description: At least 10 people were reported killed in attacks in Ukraine’s war-ravaged northeast on Sunday, as Russia pushed ahead with its renewed offensive

item.title: Member of Israel's War Cabinet says he'll quit the government June 8 unless there's a new war plan
item.description: A popular centrist member of Israel’s three-man War Cabinet has threatened to resign from the government if it doesn’t adopt a new plan for the war in Gaza in the next three weeks

item.title: Argentine president begins unusual visit to Spain, snubbing officials and courting the far-right
item.description: Even before kicking off a three-day visit to Madrid, Argentina’s libertarian President Javier Milei has stirred controversy, accusing the socialist government of bringing “poverty and death” to Spain and weighing in on corruption allegations against th...

item.title: Water, water everywhere ... most is now safe to drink in an English village after parasite outbreak
item.description: Most residents near a scenic fishing village in southwestern England were told their tap water is safe to drink again after a parasite sickened more than 45 people

item.title: Dead or alive? Parents of children gone in Sri Lanka's civil war have spent 15 years seeking answers
item.description: It has been 15 years since the end of Sri Lanka's civil war, which pitted government forces against Tamil Tiger separatists

item.title: As killings surge, Haitians struggle to bury loved ones and find closure in violent capital
item.description: Finding closure for loved ones killed by gangs on a relentless rampage through Haiti’s capital and beyond is growing harder day by day in a country where burial rituals are sacred and the dead venerated

item.title: Taiwan's new president inherits a strong foreign policy position but political gridlock at home
item.description: He inherits a strong foreign policy position but political gridlock at home.

item.title: Flash floods due to unusually heavy rains kill at least 50 people in Afghanistan
item.description: Taliban officials say flash floods from heavy seasonal rains have killed at least 68 people in Afghanistan, adding the death toll was based on preliminary reports

item.title: Venezuelan opposition presidential candidate Gonzalez seeks unity in first rally
item.description: The presidential candidate of Venezuela’s chief opposition coalition has sought to cultivate a mood of hope and possibility in a large rally that marked the start of a campaign he admittedly never imagined leading

item.title: WikiLeaks founder facing pivotal moment in long fight to stay out of US court
item.description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange faces what could be his final court hearing in England over whether he should be extradited to the United States to face spying charges

item.title: Police say 2 people are dead and 5 are missing in Hungary after a boat collision on the Danube River
item.description: Police say 2 people are dead and 5 are missing in Hungary after a boat collision on the Danube River

item.title: Gunfire in Congo’s capital as men in military uniform clash with politician's guards
item.description: Congo’s army says it has “foiled a coup” and arrested the perpetrators, including several foreigners, following a shootout between armed men in military uniform and guards of a close ally of Congo’s president that left three people dead in the capital,...

item.title: Protesters rally in Peru against decree classifying seven gender identities as “mental illness”
item.description: Sexual diversity activists have protested in Peru’s capital in front of the health ministry to demand that the government repeal a decree that characterizes seven gender identities, including transgenderism, as “mental illnesses.”

item.title: Slovak PM's condition remains serious but prognosis positive after assassination bid
item.description: Slovakia’s defense minister says the country's populist prime minister, Robert Fico, remains in serious condition but now has a positive prognosis, four days after he was shot multiple times in an assassination attempt that sent shockwaves across the d...

item.title: Dominicans vote in general elections with eyes on crisis in neighboring Haiti
item.description: Voters in the Dominican Republic are casting ballots in general elections likely to reinforce the government’s crackdown on its shared border with crisis-stricken Haiti

item.title: A court in Slovakia says a suspect charged with attempting to assassinate Prime Minister Fico will remain in detention
item.description: A court in Slovakia says a suspect charged with attempting to assassinate Prime Minister Fico will remain in detention
